title: The reminiscences of Thomas Dibdin,
author: Dibdin, Thomas
snippet: There is no occasion to retain any of the present songs ; only contrive to produce Braham and Storace in the masquerade, with a new song for Munden, Fawcett, or Emery.

title: The reminiscences of Thomas Dibdin,
author: Dibdin, Thomas
snippet: Reeve's comic compositions, sung by Storace, Fawcett, and Munden, have scarcely been equalled ; nor will Corri's Bird Song be soon forgotten.

title: The reminiscences of Thomas Dibdin,
author: Dibdin, Thomas
snippet: Should any one be surprised that this lapse of memory could occurto so consummate and experienced a judge as Mr. Harris, they will please to observe that this was the first stage rehearsal of the farce Mr. H. had been present at: he had heretofore only seen so many simple words upon paper ; and it may easily be conceived what the fillings-up, in acting, of an Emery, Fawcett, Mattocks, Knight, and others would effect, I took it for an undeniable  omen in favour of my venture, the success of which, on the fifteenth night of '* Ramah Droog," fully justified the verdict given on its first trial at the Maidstone assizes.
